title: Sarcoidosis Treatment Protocol — Foundation for Sarcoidosis Research
cleaned_text: Diagnosis and Detection of Sarcoidosis. An Official American Thoracic Society Clinical Practice Guideline* The American Thoracic Society has published an official clinical practice guideline and conditional recommendations and a best practice statement to improve diagnosis and detection of sarcoidosis in vital organs. To download the ATS guidelines, [visit here.](https://www.atsjournals.org/doi/10.1164/rccm.202002-0251ST) FSR Connected Authors: - Elliott D. Baughman - FSR Scientific Advisory Board Member & FSR Clinical Studies Network Member European Respiratory Society (ERS) Clinical Practice Guidelines on Treatment of Sarcoidosis** The ERS Task Force Committee created international clinical practice guidelines for the treatment of sarcoidosis. To view the guidelines, [click](https://erj.ersjournals.com/content/58/6/2004079) [here. ](https://erj.ersjournals.com/content/58/6/2004079) FSR Connected Authors: - Robert P. Culver - FSR Clinical Studies Network Member Sarcoidosis Associated Pulmonary Hypertension (SAPH) Diagnosis and Management Statement*** FSR partnered with WASOG to bring together a panel of pulmonary experts in late 2019 to create a dialogue and education physicians on Sarcoidosis Associated Pulmonary Hypertension (SAPH). This meeting was sponsored and made possible through funding support by Bayer. This meeting resulted in a statement on the diagnosis and management of SAPH. [Click here to view.](https://err.ersjournals.com/content/31/163/210165) FSR Connected Authors: - Daniel A. Culver - FSR Clinical Studies Network Member - Tamara Al-Hakim - FSR Research Project Manager - Robert P. Baughman - FSR Scientific Advisory Board Member & Clinical Studies Network Member Heart Rhythm Society (HRS) HRS Expert Consensus Statement on the Diagnosis and Management of Arrhythmias Associated With Cardiac Sarcoidosis**** The international expert consensus statement was written by experts in the field who were chosen by the Hearth Rhythm Society in collaboration with representatives from the American College of Cardiology, American College of Chest Physicians, American Heart Association, Asia Pacific Heart Rhythm Society, European Heart Rhythm Association, and World Association for Sarcoidosis and Other Granulomatous Disorders. To view the guidelines, click [here](https://www.heartrhythmjournal.com/article/S1547-5271(14)00335-X/fulltext) (These guidelines are behind a pay wall). FSR Connected Authors: - Marc A.
